input.sentences: everyone grabs a sign and begin to march in protest .
these guys are very enthusiastic about the protest . they even bring a drum .
these kids are too young to know what 's going on . their parents make them wear signs to support their cause .
a man from the protest is able to get on local television . he gives a rousing speech in order to convince others to support his cause .
these people gather around a big sign that reads `` immigrant rights are human rights . '' they are tired of not having rights and they are letting everyone know they are fed up .
output.sentences: On the day of the rally, a young boy held a Free Mandela sign as the protest began with a march.
The protest was attended by many types of people including guys who were enthusiastic musicians.
The protestors were encourage to wear comfortable shoes to support their feet and the children made signs to carry along wduring the march.
Television reporters interviewed civilians in support of the march and recored a riveting speech delivered by an onlooker.
The people were tired of the corrupt government regime and viewed the protest as a sign that all human rights to freedom would be restored.
